designScenario.name: Fuel Quantity Measurement System
designScenario.description: The Fuel Quantity Measurement System (FQMS) is responsible for accurately determining and monitoring the aircraft's fuel quantity in real-time across all flight phases. It utilizes capacitive fuel probes, compensates for environmental variables like temperature and aircraft attitude, and integrates with flight management systems to provide critical data for fuel efficiency calculations, balance management, and safety compliance. The system incorporates redundancy, self-diagnostic capabilities, and fail-safe mechanisms to ensure reliability under diverse operational conditions.

details.description: Measure fuel mass/volume in all tanks using capacitive probes with temperature compensation to account for fuel density variations.
Implement aircraft attitude correction algorithms to compensate for fuel slosh and tank geometry during maneuvers.
Maintain measurement accuracy within ±1% of total fuel capacity across operational temperature ranges.
Update fuel quantity calculations at minimum 500ms intervals during critical flight phases.
Implement triple modular redundancy for probe signal processing with voting logic to isolate faulty channels.
Provide continuous built-in test (BIT) capabilities to detect probe failures or signal degradation.
Design modular probe interfaces compliant with ARINC 706 standards for simplified replacement.
Meet DO-160G environmental qualifications for fuel tank EMI and lightning strike susceptibility.

systemComponents.name: Fuel Quantity Probes
systemComponents.description: Capacitive sensing units installed in fuel tanks measuring dielectric constant variations between fuel and air.

subComponents.name: Capacitive Sensor Array
subComponents.description: Multiple concentric tube capacitors measuring fuel level through impedance changes.

subComponents.name: Temperature Compensator
subComponents.description: Integrated PT100 RTD for real-time dielectric constant compensation.

systemComponents.name: Measurement Processing Unit (MPU)
systemComponents.description: Central computer processing probe signals, implementing compensation algorithms, and managing redundancy.

subComponents.name: Signal Conditioning Module
subComponents.description: Converts analog probe signals to digital with 24-bit resolution.

subComponents.name: Fault Detection and Isolation
subComponents.description: Triple-channel comparator with mid-value selection logic.

systemComponents.name: Fuel Quantity Indicator
systemComponents.description: Cockpit display interface showing total/individual tank quantities and system status.

subComponents.name: Primary Display Module
subComponents.description: LED/LCD display driver with ARINC 429 output

subComponents.name: Low Fuel Alert Generator
subComponents.description: Independent threshold comparator for crew alerts

systemComponents.name: Fuel Data Interface
systemComponents.description: Communication gateway sharing fuel data with FMS, ECAM, and maintenance systems.

subComponents.name: ARINC 429 Transceiver
subComponents.description: Handles bidirectional communication with flight deck systems

subComponents.name: Data Concentrator
subComponents.description: Aggregates fuel data from multiple tanks into standardized formats

relationships.description: The MPU contains dedicated signal processing channels for each fuel quantity probe assembly.
The indicator receives processed fuel data from the MPU via dedicated avionics buses.
The interface aggregates fuel data from multiple MPU channels for system-wide distribution.
Each fuel probe contains an integrated temperature compensation module.
